info.title: Snowflake
info.description: Snowflake Connector allows you to build canvas apps and surface Snowflake data in Virtual Tables, while also enabling faster data processing and analytics compared to traditional solutions. This version fixes support for null values in columns of date and time types.

parameters.name: $apply
parameters.description: A sequence of OData aggregation transformations

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An ODATA filter query to restrict the entries returned (e.g. stringColumn eq 'string' OR numberColumn lt 123).

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: An ODATA orderBy query for specifying the order of entries.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip (default = 0).

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Total number of entries to retrieve (default = all).

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Specific fields to retrieve from entries (default = all).

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Option to specify if only total entity count should be returned in the query (default = false).

post.description: This operation creates a record and allows null values.

get.description: This operation gets a row from a table.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Specific fields to retrieve from entries (default = all).

patch.summary: Patches a specific item in the table
patch.description: Patches a specific item in the table

get.description: This operation lists the available Snowflake object types.

post.description: Submit a SQL Statement for Execution

parameters.name: Instance
parameters.description: The uri of your Snowflake instance (without https://)

parameters.name: asyncexecution
parameters.description: Indicates if the query should be executed asynchronously

parameters.name: nullable
parameters.description: If nullable is false, null values will be replaced by string

statement.description: The SQL statement to be executed - batches of statements not yet supported

timeout.description: Number of seconds before timeout occurs

bindings.description: Values of bind variables in the SQL statement. When executing the statement, Snowflake replaces placeholders ('?' and ':name') in the statement with these specified values.

parameters.description: Session parameters that should be set before executing the statement.

timezone.description: Time zone to use when executing the statement.

query_tag.description: Query tag that you want to associate with the SQL statement.

MULTI_STATEMENT_COUNT.description: Number of statements to execute when using multi-statement capability. 0 implies variable number of statements. Negative numbers are not allowed.

200.description: The statement was executed successfully, and the response includes any data requested.

202.description: The execution of the statement is still in progress. Use this method again to check the status of the statement execution.

400.description: Bad Request. The request payload is invalid or malformed.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request is not authorized.

404.description: Not Found. The request endpoint is not valid.

405.description: Method Not Allowed. The request method doesn't match the supported API.

408.description: The execution of the statement exceeded the timeout period. The execution of the statement was cancelled.

createdOn.description: Timestamp that specifies when the statement execution started. The timestamp is expressed in milliseconds since the epoch

415.description: The request header Content-Type includes unsupported media type. The API supports application/json only.

422.description: The execution of the statement exceeded the timeout period. The execution of the statement was cancelled.

createdOn.description: Timestamp that specifies when the statement execution started. The timestamp is expressed in milliseconds since the epoch

429.description: Limit Exceeded. The number of requests hit the rate limit.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The server hits an unrecoverable system error.

503.description: Service Unavailable. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts.

post.description: Check the Status of the Execution of a Statement and Get the Results

parameters.description: The uri of your Snowflake instance (without https://)

202.description: The execution of the statement is still in progress. Use this method again to check the status of the statement execution.

400.description: Bad Request. The request payload is invalid or malformed.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request is not authorized.

404.description: Not Found. The request endpoint is not valid.

createdOn.description: Timestamp that specifies when the statement execution started. The timestamp is expressed in milliseconds since the epoch

500.description: Internal Server Error. The server hits an unrecoverable system error.

503.description: Service Unavailable. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts.

post.summary: Cancel the Execution of a Statement
post.description: Cancel the Execution of a Statement

parameters.name: Instance
parameters.description: The uri of your Snowflake instance (without https://)

400.description: Bad Request. The request payload is invalid or malformed.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request is not authorized.

404.description: Not Found. The request endpoint is not valid.

405.description: Method Not Allowed. The request method doesn't match the supported API.

422.description: The execution of the statement exceeded the timeout period. The execution of the statement was cancelled.

PassThroughNativeQuery.description: static schema for pass-through native query execution

Name.description: The name of the table. The name is used at runtime.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the table.

DynamicProperties.description: Additional table properties provided by the connector to the clients.

serverPagingOptions.description: List of supported server-driven paging capabilities

filterable.description: Indicates whether this table has filterable columns

selectable.description: Indicates whether this table has selectable columns

countable.description: Indicates whether this table has countable columns

sortable.description: Indicates whether this table has sortable columns

ascendingOnlyProperties.description: List of properties which support ascending order only
